meanings.definition: Not causing immediate death but still harmful or damaging.
meanings.sent1: The sublethal dose of medicine helped the patient without causing any serious side effects.
meanings.sent2: The sublethal exposure to the sun resulted in a mild sunburn.
meanings.sent3: The sublethal amount of sugar in the cake made it taste just right.
meanings.sent4: The sublethal impact of the storm left only minor damage to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The sublethal bite of the puppy was more playful than painful.

meanings.definition: Below the lethal level in terms of toxicity or harm.
meanings.sent1: The sublethal concentration of chemicals in the water posed a low risk to aquatic life.
meanings.sent2: The sublethal dose of the poison was not enough to cause serious harm.
meanings.sent3: The sublethal level of noise in the classroom made it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent4: The sublethal effect of the pesticide protected the crops without harming the environment.
meanings.sent5: The sublethal presence of predators kept the prey on high alert.
